message: that's sad because an app that includes google custom search on pages would be great
the google custom search api uses "google.load()" to load the search api. That messes everything when run from inside KBX
@loic Sorry, but no. Have not used google custom srarch
is this a sandboxing issue? It is still possible to run code outside the sandbox, by injecting it as a string. It's generally not what you want to do.

yes injecting it as a string helps when the code is your own code. but when the code comes from another API like the google APIS that rely on dynamic loading and callbacks everything becomes very complicated inside the sandbox and usually ends with "undefined function somefunction" .
the only option is to stay entirely outside the sandbox in those cases. It can be done, but requires lots of attention to the execution environment of the js.
I would be very thankful if you could write us an example that works in KBX
Google proposes tons of very interesting APIS in javascript http://code.google.com/more/
remind me, and we'll get an example up.
or even a module which exposes helper functions
